children.value: (Lower than naïve $9.4M due to demand reduction)
Who actually bears the tax burden?
With beer demand elasticity ε = -0.29 (semi-log at $12.50):

children.html: θ=11−ϵ=11.29=0.78\theta = \frac{1}{1 - \epsilon} = \frac{1}{1.29} = 0.78θ=1−ϵ1​=1.291​=0.78

children.value: This is standard tax incidence: more inelastic side bears more burden.
Use $6.7M to reduce property taxes in the Bronx
Increase police presence, security on game days
Subsidize ticket prices or public transportation
Target spending toward externality reduction (safety, health).
